verses.verse: So I <S%H7725>returned<s%>, and <S%H7200>considered<s%> all the <S%H6217>oppressions<s%> that are <S%H6213>done<s%> under the <S%H8121>sun<s%>: and behold the <S%H1832>tears<s%> of such as were <S%H6231>oppressed<s%>, and they had no <S%H5162>comforter<s%>; and on the <S%H3027>side<s%> of their <S%H6231>oppressors<s%> there was <S%H3581>power<s%>; but they had no <S%H5162>comforter<s%>. side: Heb. hand
Wherefore I <S%H7623>praised<s%> the <S%H4191>dead<s%> which are <S%H3528>already<s%> <S%H4191>dead<s%> more than the <S%H2416>living<s%> which are <S%H5728>yet<s%> <S%H2416>alive<s%>.

Yea, <S%H2896>better<s%> is he than <S%H8147>both<s%> they, which hath not <S%H5728>yet<s%> been, who hath not <S%H7200>seen<s%> the <S%H7451>evil<s%> <S%H4639>work<s%> that is <S%H6213>done<s%> under the <S%H8121>sun<s%>.

Again, I <S%H7200>considered<s%> all <S%H5999>travail<s%>, and every <S%H3788>right<s%> <S%H4639>work<s%>, that for this a <S%H376>man<s%> is <S%H7068>envied<s%> of his <S%H7453>neighbour<s%>. This is also <S%H1892>vanity<s%> and <S%H7469>vexation<s%> of <S%H7307>spirit<s%>. every: Heb. all the rightness of work for this: Heb. this is the envy of a man from his neighbour

<S%H2896>Better<s%> is an <S%H3709>handful<s%> with <S%H5183>quietness<s%>, than both the <S%H2651>hands<s%> <S%H4393>full<s%> with <S%H5999>travail<s%> and <S%H7469>vexation<s%> of <S%H7307>spirit<s%>.
Then I <S%H7725>returned<s%>, and I <S%H7200>saw<s%> <S%H1892>vanity<s%> under the <S%H8121>sun<s%>.

There <S%H3426>is<s%> <S%H259>one<s%> alone, and there is not a <S%H8145>second<s%>; yea, he hath neither <S%H1121>child<s%> nor <S%H251>brother<s%>: yet is there no <S%H7093>end<s%> of all his <S%H5999>labour<s%>; neither is his <S%H5869>eye<s%> <S%H7646>satisfied<s%> with <S%H6239>riches<s%>; neither saith he, For whom do I <S%H6001>labour<s%>, and <S%H2637>bereave<s%> my <S%H5315>soul<s%> of <S%H2896>good<s%>? This is also <S%H1892>vanity<s%>, yea, it is a <S%H7451>sore<s%> <S%H6045>travail<s%>.
<S%H8147>Two<s%> are <S%H2896>better<s%> than <S%H259>one<s%>; because they <S%H3426>have<s%> a <S%H2896>good<s%> <S%H7939>reward<s%> for their <S%H5999>labour<s%>.

For if they <S%H5307>fall<s%>, the <S%H259>one<s%> will lift <S%H6965>up<s%> his <S%H2270>fellow<s%>: but <S%H337>woe<s%> to him that is <S%H259>alone<s%> when he <S%H5307>falleth<s%>; for he hath not <S%H8145>another<s%> to help him <S%H6965>up<s%>.
<S%H1571>Again<s%>, if <S%H8147>two<s%> lie <S%H7901>together<s%>, then they have <S%H2552>heat<s%>: but how can <S%H259>one<s%> be <S%H3179>warm<s%> alone?

And if <S%H259>one<s%> <S%H8630>prevail<s%> against him, <S%H8147>two<s%> shall <S%H5975>withstand<s%> him; and a <S%H8027>threefold<s%> <S%H2339>cord<s%> is not <S%H4120>quickly<s%> <S%H5423>broken<s%>.

<S%H2896>Better<s%> is a <S%H4542>poor<s%> and a <S%H2450>wise<s%> <S%H3206>child<s%> than an <S%H2205>old<s%> and <S%H3684>foolish<s%> <S%H4428>king<s%>, who <S%H3045>will<s%> no more be <S%H2094>admonished<s%>. who: Heb. who knoweth not to be admonished
For out of <S%H631>prison<s%> <S%H1004><s%> he <S%H3318>cometh<s%> to <S%H4427>reign<s%>; whereas also he that is <S%H3205>born<s%> in his <S%H4438>kingdom<s%> becometh <S%H7326>poor<s%>.

I <S%H7200>considered<s%> all the <S%H2416>living<s%> which <S%H1980>walk<s%> under the <S%H8121>sun<s%>, with the <S%H8145>second<s%> <S%H3206>child<s%> that shall stand <S%H5975>up<s%> in his stead.

There is no <S%H7093>end<s%> of all the <S%H5971>people<s%>, even of all that have been <S%H6440>before<s%> them: they also that come <S%H314>after<s%> shall not <S%H8055>rejoice<s%> in him. Surely this also is <S%H1892>vanity<s%> and <S%H7475>vexation<s%> of <S%H7307>spirit<s%>.
